page.title: 10RELIGION ON ST.MARTINS I.O.S
page.content: On this island we have a church,it was built in 1866.In the summer there is a service every week,taken by vicars who spend a holiday in the Parsonage,which was once the home of a resident clergyman.The vicar who lives on the main island comes over once a month to take a service during the winter. We also have a Methodist Chapel that was build in 1836.It has a Sunday School room next to it,but there are not enough children now to run a Sunday School.It is only used twice a year for the Easter and Harvest teas.Each week throughout the year we have a chapel service.Usually it is taken by the Minister or a Local Preacher who cross over from St.Mary's weather permitting.Sometimes holiday makers take a service and occasionally there is a united service.
